content: The word skepticism has appeared in my posts for more than enough time, that's probably because of my experiences with it (both the good and bad).Skepticism is characterized by Doubt, Disbelief, Uncertainty and Agnosticism and also Scrutiny, Inquisition, Investigation and Probe. Aforementioned are words categorised into two group which I refer to as first phase and second phase. The first phase can be generalise as Doubt, it's a phase where our lack of knowledge of an entity/subject makes us feel unsure about it; at this phase, our sense of judgement is clouded with disbelief and uncertainty. We can call the second phase the Curiosity phase, this is the period we want to put all things to test to make sure we are making the right decision, this phase birth Scrutiny, Inquisition, Investigation and Probe. At this phase, we overly seek for knowledge about something because we want to satisfy our curiosity. While being skeptical is not bad, many of us fall at the first phase of it, we only exercise doubt and disbelief about an entity/subject without seeking knowledge about it. The fact that we are unsure of something should make us eager to want to know about it, this attitude towards life could help us redeem situations where good opportunity always pass us by due to the fact that we base our judgement on the first phase (Doubt). The second phase helps us to make decision rationally and our decision would be based on facts rather than assumptions or dogma. After making our decision based on the knowledge we've acquired about the subject, we are left with the knowledge and it could  help us sometimes in the future. This has happened  to many cryptocurrency investors or trader at a point in time, it also happens mostly to beginners (most especially the ones who have experienced scam). It made them miss out on great opportunity that has come their ways that could have transformed their lives. When our skepticism end in the first phase, it deprived us of the positive impact skepticism could have on us. Skepticism should yield curiosity, while curiosity birth Knowledge!

comments.author: hatshepsut93
comments.body: In cryptocurrency, skepticims more often than not saves people from losses, because most of the "opportunities" lead to a loss. Even if you take altcoins that showed great growth, it only counts as opportunity if you manage to sell with a profit, which a lot of people don't do, as they get greedy. And then the market crashes and they miss out on any profit at all.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Doubts, of course, should be resolved. In doing so, knowledge is probably gained. But you don't resolve each and every doubt. Sooner or later, you will have wisdom; you will know the pattern. You will immediately know a scam when you see one. And so you can make generalizations. That's what knowledge gives us. Having said this, you don't have to scrutinize and investigate each and every altcoin, each and every airdrop, each and every NFT project, each and every DeFi platform, and so on. Somehow, you can make a generalization.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: I should doubt everything rather than be naive and believe in any proposal that promises millions. Have newbies who saved their money by having doubts about projects lost something? I don't see it this way. There is no need to rush until you understand all the consequences that may await you. Although cryptocurrency is, of course, a risk in some ways, we must be 90 percent sure that we know everything about the project in which we would like to invest. And from this, it follows that we question everything to make the right decision in the future.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Skeptical+qeust/reseach= knowledge in whatever field of investment your ability to question things will always give birth to knowledge and having the knowledge and right information from the search will help you make quality decisions and in this field cryptocurrency is a risky adventure so if you don't build adequate knowledge you may make the wrong decision about the project to trust, but with at least 70% understanding about a project, you should be able to manage your way around it to make a quality decision on when to invest in it or not. comments.author: Sacrod
comments.body: Skepticism has to do with our attitude towards something. It deals with an intellectual inquiry and caution applied to an information, ideas and things being presented to us. It is an essential part of critical thinking,  it helps us to embrace objective truth which deals with what is universally true and accepted as opposed to being satisfied with what we know and settling for personal or subjective truth.Skepticism helps us to ask questions, challenge claims, make enquiry about things.  It also encourages us not to accept authority because we know it's source or think the information is true.  The same yardstick should be used to scrutinize ever information so as to be on the safer side and this helps us to gain more knowledge and make progress.  We need not stop at the doubtful phase of skepticism, progress can only be made when we seek more knowledge about things.
